intro: Byrsonima monticola, commonly known as the mountain huito, is a shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain several seeds, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and can tolerate dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
